meanings.definition: To cause something to change direction by hitting it at an angle.
meanings.sent1: The mirror can deflect the light towards the ceiling.
meanings.sent2: She used the umbrella to deflect the raindrops away from her.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's shield can deflect any attack effortlessly.
meanings.sent4: Her positive attitude can deflect negativity like a shield.
meanings.sent5: The goalie's quick reflexes allowed him to deflect the ball away from the goal.

meanings.definition: To turn aside or away from a straight course.
meanings.sent1: The player tried to deflect the ball towards his teammate.
meanings.sent2: The river's current can deflect floating objects off their path.
meanings.sent3: The detective's clever plan managed to deflect suspicion away from him.
meanings.sent4: Her sudden joke was able to deflect the serious conversation in a different direction.
meanings.sent5: The wind can deflect the trajectory of a flying kite.

meanings.definition: To prevent something from affecting or harming you.
meanings.sent1: Wearing sunscreen can deflect harmful UV rays from your skin.
meanings.sent2: His quick thinking helped deflect any blame from falling on him.
meanings.sent3: The cat's playful antics can deflect attention from its mischief.
meanings.sent4: Her strong immune system can deflect most common illnesses.
meanings.sent5: A good defense strategy can deflect potential threats effectively.
